guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for warfarin and CYP2C9

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 9

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299075

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for warfarin in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on warfarin.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299071

text.html: 1. use 65% of the standard initial dose. The genotype-specific initial dose and maintenance dose can be calculated using an algorithm, as used in EU-PACT: see Algorithms coumarins. From day 6 on the standard algorithm without genotype information can be used to calculate the dose.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of warfarin to inactive metabolites. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299074

text.html: 1. use 20% of the standard initial dose. The genotype-specific initial dose and maintenance dose can be calculated using an algorithm. Algorithms for Caucasian patients usually contain only the *2 and *3 allele. If the activity of the reduced-activity alleles is comparable to the activity of *2 or *3, then the algorithm can be completed as if *2 or *3 is present. See Algorithms coumarins for Excel files containing calculation modules for oral and equivalent intravenous doses. From day 6 on the standard algorithm without genotype information can be used to calculate the dose. Modified dose algorithms have been developed for patients of African or (East) Asian heritage.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of warfarin to inactive metabolites. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299070

text.html: 1. use 65% of the standard initial dose. The genotype-specific initial dose and maintenance dose can be calculated using an algorithm, as used in EU-PACT: see Algorithms coumarins. From day 6 on the standard algorithm without genotype information can be used to calculate the dose.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of warfarin to inactive metabolites. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299073

text.html: 1. use 20% of the standard initial dose. The genotype-specific initial dose and maintenance dose can be calculated using an algorithm, as used in EU-PACT: see Algorithms coumarins. From day 6 on the standard algorithm without genotype information can be used to calculate the dose.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of warfarin to inactive metabolites. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299069

text.html: 1. use 65% of the standard initial dose. The genotype-specific initial dose and maintenance dose can be calculated using an algorithm. Algorithms for Caucasian patients usually contain only the *2 and *3 allele. If the activity of the reduced-activity alleles is comparable to the activity of *2 or *3, then the algorithm can be completed as if *1/*2 or *1/*3 is present. See Algorithms coumarins for Excel files containing calculation modules for oral and equivalent intravenous doses. From day 6 on the standard algorithm without genotype information can be used to calculate the dose. Modified dose algorithms have been developed for patients of African or (East) Asian heritage.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of warfarin to inactive metabolites. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299072

text.html: 1. use 45% of the standard initial dose. The genotype-specific initial dose and maintenance dose can be calculated using an algorithm, as used in EU-PACT: see Algorithms coumarins. From day 6 on the standard algorithm without genotype information can be used to calculate the dose.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of warfarin to inactive metabolites. This can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299068

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: Genetic variation may lead to a decrease in the required maintenance dose. However, there is insufficient evidence that this causes problems when therapy is initiated as usual.
